page.title: 07Local history
page.content: Hockenden house has one acre of land. It was a farm house with a dairy and a bakery which are now old and half fallen down. The house owner would have it rebuilt but she can't afford it.So the council call it a listed builing.It was built over 300 years ago.There is a priest hole in one of the bedrooms which,was used in the old days for priests to hide in,to get away from the soldiers. In the front garden there is a Walnut tree and others around the house. One of the trees was 70 foot high but it was struck by lightning.There was so much wood that they made a fence around the front garden.
